page.title: 16TRANSPORT AROUND TYWARDREATH
page.content: {Public Transport. Buses.}In our area there is only one bus route and that goes through the 3 S.W. squares. Buses come from St.Austell and they go to Fowey. We have one bus every 2 hours from 7a.m. to 7p.m. Buses do not run on Sundays. {Trains.}There is no station in our 12 sq. km but the railway line passes from the S.W. corner diagonally across the western half of our area. The main route is Penzance to Paddington with trains about every 2 hours. Other trains run to destinations further North but just 1 train a day to each region. {Private Transport. Mineral Train.}This runs on the W.bank of the River Fowey. It belongs to English China Clays and brings clay to Fowey Docks. It is then exported. Lots of people have{cars} because of lack of Public Transport.
